column2: MONTANA PERMIT TEST
column6: MT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column6: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 2. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column6: Crash-Prevention Driving

column2: 3. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 4. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column6: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: swing to the right side of your lane.

column2: 5. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 6. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 7. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 8. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: green, red and yellow

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn

column2: 10. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 11. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: parking lights.

column2: 12. A red traffic sign means?
column6: Wrong way.

column2: 13. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: stay near the right of your lane.
column6: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
column8: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.

column2: 14. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column6: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 16. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may stop to let out passengers.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column10: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Yield right-of-way
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 18. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column6: no sharp turn

column2: 19. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 20. ______________ is an unsafe distraction when driving.
column4: Asking a passenger to enter your mapping request into your GPS.
column6: Leaving early to drive to an appointment.
column8: Controlling an emotion before putting the vehicle in gear.
column10: Texting a message on your cell phone.

column2: 21. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column6: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column8: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column10: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic must turn right

column2: 23. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a narrow bridge ahead.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 24. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.
column6: a yield sign.

column2: 25. To help relieve fatigue on a trip:
column6: change feet on the gas pedal.
column10: stop for a rest every two hours.

column2: 26. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 27. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.

column2: 28. A green arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations.
column6: is used only on one-way streets.
column8: means that you may go only if the green arrow is accompanied by a green light.
column10: means the same as a circular green light, but you must go only in the direction indicated by the arrow.

column2: 29. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column6: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Warning

column2: 31. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: move to another lane if possible.
column10: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.

column2: 32. Drinking alcohol and then driving is dangerous because it affects your:
column6: reflexes.

column2: 33. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 31. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: move to another lane if possible.
column10: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.

column2: 32. Drinking alcohol and then driving is dangerous because it affects your:
column6: reflexes.

column2: 33. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
